text: On tap @ Edinburgh Beer Festival. Heavy scotch vibes but also some caramel to offset those strident flavors, tastes a bit boozy but in a warming way, nice lacing
Strong whiskey on the nose. Woodsy flavour with long whiskey finish. I personally dont like whiskey, but objectively think this is a good barrel aged brew for those who do enjoy such tastes.
Taster EBCF. Pours deep copper/amber, minimal white head. Aroma quite muted - soft red fruits, hint of port/claret. Much bigger taste - prunes, Armagnac, caramel, molasses, nice booze hit. Great.
Bottle from Saveur beer. Pours brown with red hues. Oak, honey, raisin, cherry nose with hint of cocoa. Flavour is a caramel with a earthy oak, chocolate, honey finish. Smooth with an alcohol finish.

Amberbrownish color with lightly beige head. toffe, malts, hints of coaly woody smokiness. Sherry comes through in the flavour. Great mouthfeel, medium sweetness. The body travels to lighter to more full and ends with a creamy bitter dry end. Beautiful. A little bit more aroma would be nice, the taste and the mouthfeel is awesome.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.
Typical scotch ale nose. Didnt like this beer, way too sweet and alcohol too present.

35cl bottle, thanks to k0mpsa. This effort of brewing in its style reminds me of saying: Dont join an easy crowd. You wont grow. Go where the expectations and the demands to perform and achieve are high. Jim Rohn. Something different and delicious. Lengthy.

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 28th December 2018. Poured into a snifter. It was a cloudy brown colour with quite a bit of small to tiny sediment, a thin tanned head that dissipated quickly and some sparse spotty lacing. Aromas were sweet, malty, caramel, dark dried fruit, wood with some light smoke and alcohol. Tastes of roasted malts, caramel, wood, vanilla and smoke. There is some whisky character, and light sweet dark dried fruit, mostly prunes and raisins. Full bodied with light carbonation. Overall, I find that not many beers taste better than its aroma, but this beer falls in that category. The sweetness coming from the aroma kind of put me off a bit. But this was not the case when I tasted it as the barrel character was clearly the main attraction (smoke, vanilla, wood) and it was a good thing (for me), that the sweetness of the dried fruit was only in the background.
Bottle from alus celle, riga. Deep brown color, tanned head. Wonderful aroma has oak notes, sweet caramel notes, some plums. Balanced sweet body, burnt sugar, plums, oak notes.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Shmupi. Dark brown. Smoky, wood, malt, some vanilla, caramel, dark fruits, sweet, a bit of bitterness, warm alcohol, rounded mouthfeel.

330ml bottle shared. Cloudy dark brown with a thin off white head that left some great lacing down the glass. Aroma is sweet caramel malt, dried fruit and alcohol. Flavour is the same, with dark chocolate and a little leather. Like an Belgian abbey beer but less yeasty
Murky, reddish-brown beer. Smells of malt, chocolate, caramel, fruit. Flavour has the same qualities. A toasted taste to it as well. Rich and smooth with a fruity finish to it.

Dark brown with small beige/light brown head. Malty aroma with roasted notes. Strong bitterness with medium sweetness (derlinga - on too of bitterness), malty and strong roasted notes. Lasting bitter aftertaste.

Pours dark brown with medium beige head that quickly vanishes. Nose is caramel and wood. Sweet in taste. Aromas are toasted and roasted malts, caramel, dry fruits, wood barrels, with a peaty/earthy note. Alcohol warm. Low carbonation, full body. Long roasted, bitter and alcoholic finish.

Bottle from Saveur Biere. Hazy very dark brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit, wood and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily and soft. 061116

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 33B / 17C, adapted). Bottle 33 cl - Batch B000117 (BBF 28-DEZ-2018). AROMA: complex aroma with a slight sweet malt note, dark chocolate, slight coffee, faint smoke and wood and a blend of sherry-like aroma. APPEARANCE: brown ro dark brown-color with rubi body against light. cristal clear. Medium-low light brown head with low retention. lace formation. TASTE: similar to the aroma with a sherry-like flavor, slight toasty malt and faint wood. vinous-like alcohol presence. medium-low bitterness with a semi-dry finish and slight toasty. PALATE: medium-high body and velvety. low carbonation. smooth alcohol warmth. OVERALL: a very nice and complex barrel aged, strong scottish ale.

Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Murky, muddy brown. Halo of beige head. Not a looker. Nose has sticking plaster. Some sweet smoke. Some vine fruit and sweet oak. Taste is sweet and raisin chewy. LeAnn Rimes looks good in that dress. Nice cleavage. Beer has decent body. Slick and rich, but weighs in under the ABV. Some tangy, vinous, fruity bitterness on the finish.
Bottle. Dark brown color, creamy foam. Aroma and taste: barrels, caramel, prunes, whisky, sherry, warming.
Aromat ziemisty, beczkowy, karmelowy, suszone i czerwone owoce. Smak słodki, karmelowy, drewno, susz. Dobre

330ml bottle. Dark brownish amber shade. Short head. Strong malty aroma, meaty, smoky, lots of barrel influence. Taste has a lot of red fruits and caramel. Drinkability is decent. Well put together stuff.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black brown beer with no carbonation and small ivory head. Smell: caramel malt, toffee, alcohol notes. High malt concentration. Sweet. Taste: full body with roasted malt notes, caramel malt. Toffee, sweet domination. Good caramel notes. Very intensive. Superb balance, quiet drinkable. Good attenuation. Roasted notes, alcohol finish. Aftertaste: roasted notes, caramel and toffee, alcohol. Wow!

Scotch ale-hez ritkábban van szerencsém, imperial változathoz még inkább, a bourbon és sherry hordók említése pedig külön öröm a számomra. Krémes, tejszínes aromákkal indít, az érlelés adta jegyek a meghatározók, süteményes, lekváros piskótás illatelemek kíséretében. A sherry és a whisky karaktere is tisztán kivehető némi idő elteltével, bár a kavalkád nem a letisztultság jegyében zajlik. Kissé darabos az ízvilág is, egy utolsó simítás még ráférne, de önmagukban igen élvezetes benyomást nyújtanak a befőttes, lágy és krémes, cseresznyés, fekete bogyós, zsúfoltig tömött malátás elemek. Vaníliás bourbon-jegyek, száraz sherry-hangulatok, likőrös kicsengés teszi élvezetessé a nehezebb műfajok rajongói számára.
Couleur noire, légère mousse. Nez puissant sur le café, café vert, alcool, note boisee. Gout café sucré, vieux fruits, praliné, cremeux, un peu torrefie, note alcool et chene. Superbe
-cask hanging bat- black with beige head. Whiskey, vanilla, herbal and oak. Smooth, slick, velvety and whiskey finish. Great!

Deep brown body, small brownish head. Aroma of many different caramel layers, dried fruits, wood, alcohol fusel, vanilla, behind very light acidic-vinegar-like aroma. Flavours of caramel, toasted malt, wood, vanilla, alcohol fusel, hoppy bitter backbone. Medium sweet caramely finish. Ends up warm, bitter and dry.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 33cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Hazy amber.
T: Roasted malt, caramel, raisins, licorice, alcohol.

10%ABV. Imperial scotch ale.

Poured out rusty brown. 28ºSRM.

Nose has overripe fruit, candy, malt, corn syrup and honey. There is also from a distance a whiff of fresh barley water.

Mouthfeel is syrupy and honey water. Palate is honey, toasted Graham cracker, caramel, butterscotch, brown sugar, molasses. Nice mid palate of dark, brown wheat toast and sweet corn. No hops.

Finish is sweet and sticky.

Goes on Favorites List !

330ml bottle. Black-brown colour, beige foam head leaving some lacing and aroma of chocolate, malt, woody, vanilla, booze. Taste is roasted malt, caramel, milk chocolate, dried fruits, raisins, oak, vanilla, warm boozy. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carnbonation, dry roast bitter finish. Very drinkable.

33cl bottle at home from Brewdog webshop. Nose is dark berries, roasted malt, slightly liqueurish. Body is very dark brown, head is medium, beige, creamy, average lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is caramel, milk chocolate, chocolate liqueur, herbs, dried fruits, dark berries, mild coffee. Medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter, medium fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting roasty fruity medium bittersweet, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. A bit heavy sweet dessert beer, alcohol is too much on the foreground and a bit too sweet for me. Feels like a heavy belgian dubbel.
Caoba oscuro y espuma beis. Aromas de chocolate, vainilla, bourbon, licor, uva pasa. Cuerpo denso y sedoso con sabor achocolatado, vainilla y bourbon con final seco, madera y regusto de tabaco.

Bottle 33cl, a cloudy amber brown beer with low head. Nose is strong on caramel, cherries, yeast and cheese. Aroma is on sweet caramel, ripped fruits, plum, toffee, yeast, blond caramel, cherries, alcohol, vanilla. The beer is better when becoming warmer.

Bottled. Pours clear deep amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of toasted malt, chocolate and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and quite bitter. Medium bodied, oily to syrupy texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Scotch. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Thanks to Owen for sharing

dark brown color with ruby highlights. Nice strips of lacing and good ABV legs. Light tan head that falls to a thin collar. 
Nose is A lot of dark fruits, slight smoke, oak and I thought whisky barrel. Nicely balanced nose. 
taste is a very forward barrel notes and a lot of smoke. dark fruits were in the background but felt needed to be brought out more. Slightly boozy but a pretty decent beer overall.

Light caramel, alcohol, prunes, dark, ripe fruits. Hazy, very dark brown, small, creamy, off-white head. Light sweet. Sweet flavours intensify, dry caramel, grain malts, light wood, fruity again. Very nice Scotch Ale, good malty flavours, sweet and yet quite dry. Bottle from Independent Spirit, Bath.

Superb all rounded sipper. Intense maltiness, pleasant heavy roast, coffee character dark choco, vinous, some bread, nut aroma, moderate sweetness with moderate to light bitterness.
Perfect balance, nicely enjoyable brew

330ml brown bottle. Pours dark dark brown with no head. Scent is medium caramel and ethanol and smoked like maybe hickory. Taste is dense caramel and further ethanol and hickory. Consistent. Mouth feel is velvet and caramel. Good, great?
Bottle. Black with a small head.Full bodied yet some complex flavours are swelling around including maltiness a subtle burnt wood taste. Yet again this brewery has come up with a good one.

33cl bottle. Dark, brownish ruby, with a fine-grained beige head that gives way to a sticky lacing. Some sedimentation floating at the top of the glass. Very smooth mouthfeel, with taste notes that include milk chocolate, cappuccino, raisins, walnuts, hazelnuts, bitter cherries, brandy and a bit of bourbon. A very complex beer.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours dark murky brown with a big fawn head. Nose of burnt toffee, peaty whisky notes, roasted malts. Silky smooth on the palate, brown sugar, dark chocolate and salted caramel.

33 cl bottle. BBE 28.12.2018.
Pours dark red-brown color with a small off-white head. Ripe fruits and mild vinous notes on the nose, malts, some caramel notes and wood. Toffee and licorice on the flavor, again some sweet ripe fruits, subtle syrupy sweetness, good malty body, slightly dark bready, some warming alcohol on the finish. Somewhat bitter malty palate, tingling wooden finish. Quite nice and thick slow sipper.
5425

Hazy brown color with light brown head. Aroma has some dusty wood and booze. Taste follows dusty, woody, boozy with some caramel and yeast esters. Quite heavy body with medium carbonation. I didnt really this one, too dusty and boozy for my taste.

This is excellent, and so much going on. Brown bread crusts, Coca Cola, nuts, light smoke, sherry, oak, fruit pastilles, cough sweets, peat, plums, liquorice, brown sauce. Dark brown with not much head. Body is full and soft with low carb.
Bottle at home. Burnt caramel, cinnamon, smoked malts, hints of dark fruit. Sticky smooth texture. Complex and rich, really good stuff.

330ml bottle (Alus Celle, Riga). Very dark brown chestnut color. Medium size, bubbly tan-yellow head, stays. Almonds, sweet, cake, caramel, alcohol, woody nd bit of whiskey in aroma. Sweet, caramel, alcohol, spicy hops, chocolate cake crumbles in taste. Dry chocolate cake in aftertaste. I get the heat, but alcohol is quite well hidden. Exciting brew.

330ml bottle shared at the Feb 2016 Shrewsbury Beer Exchange Group meeting: cheers Simon. Really liked the flavours but my dark red pour had a yeast like placenta floating under the wispy head and I had to sip slowly and carefully throughout. Sweet, fruity, woody, plums with a Sherry like boozy finish.

330ml bottle (Alus Celle, Riga)
Super deep red, hard to pull a head as its quite viscous, but when the beads to break, they froth up a pleasant off-white head. Lovely sweet nutty aroma - walnuts. Taste sweet and malty, super mellow palate. Sure, its sweet, but at 10% its a sipper, and it matters not that its a little heavy. Hops are dry and also very nutty. Like the sweet vapours that accompany the nuttiness. Crazily full sweet palate, but its a sipper, that level of heaviness is just fine. Did enjoy.

Bottle (shared by fatphil, thanks). Pours dark copper with beige head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, malt, whisky, peat. Flavor is sweet and malty, alcohol, nutty, whisky, caramel, peat. Overall: nice sweet brew. Feels like someone poured whisky in it, but it kind of works.

330ml bottle @ Shrewsbury Beer Share, Feb 16, courtesy of Simon F. Many thanks. Pours hazy reddish brown, tan head. Sweet, fruity aroma. Taste is smooth and fruity with plums and Christmas cake booze. Very nice.
Bottle at home, 12th February 16. Pours deep, dark brown, slight head. aroma is liquorice, barrel, sherry notes, oak. Taste is treacle toffee, vanilla, sweet, oak, barrel wood. Very enjoyable

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 Bottle at home. Pours dark reddish brown. Nose is caramel, wood, sweet barrel notes, vanilla, booze, light vinous notes, dried fruits. Taste is dried fruits, sweet caramel and toffee, bourbon, light bitter, boozy, finish is dried fruits, prunes and warming alcohol. Tasty and warming winter beer.

Ive had this few times and I always feel it gets better towards the end after sitting in a glass for a while. At least some bottles have been a bit too fizzy first, also better enjoy it rather warm.

1/3 pint pour from tap into tulip at Hanging Bat in Edinburgh. Black, opaque, moderate quickly-dissipating tan head. Nose is sweet, milk chocolate, light coffee. Body is think add chocolate syrup. Taste is strong black licorice, some milk chocolate, a little bitter coffee grind. Booze starting in the middle and growing for a strong burning aftertaste.

330ml bottle from The Beerhive. 
Thin off white head, good lacing. Murky brown body. Big boozy nose, sherry, whisky, dried fruits, brown sugar. Flavour is dark fruits, caramel, sherry, liquorice, lightly bitter aftertaste. Light carbonation, rich smooth mouthfeel, a little syrupy. Shows its strength in a refined manner. Big, warming, brilliant.

Bottle. Hazy brown body with a thin beige head. Faint lacing. Aroma of rum, raisin, treacle, chocolate cake and coffee. Flavour of prunes, nuts, orange peel and Coca-Cola with a peppery spice on the finish. Medium body with a slick, oily texture. Light fizz. A perfect Christmas beer - despite the slug-like yeast film that fell out with the final pour. Rich and boozy.

Bottle. RB Meeting Vienna March Edition. Thanks to Cuso. Brown body with white head. Aroma is alcohol with malts some hints of smoke. Taste is sweet with biscuits and honey. Aftertaste is sweet balanced by some hoppy bitterness.

500 ml bottle shared by Cuso at RB Tasting Vienna March Edition. Thanks!
Brown, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, beige head.
Aroma of dried fruits, spices, smoke, sweet malts, some bourbon.
Taste quite follows this, with more alcohol presence and more caramel like sweet malts.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes alcoholic, a bit dry, with sour dried fruits, some smoke.

Scotch Ale isnt my style and this one is no exception. But still a good beer and a nice opportunity, as this seems to be quite limited. Lots of sweet, heavy malts, with boozy, barrel aging notes.

Botte. RB Tasting Vienna March Edition. Dark amber body with low head. Aroma is roasty, smokey, sausage, light maple syrup. Taste has high caramel sweetness, little bit spicy, medium to low chipotle bitterness. Body is medium, medium carbonation.

Bottle from BenH, many thanks. Dark chestnut color with small white head. Sweet dark malt, caramel, light smoke, wood, alcohol. Strong sweet dark malt, raisins, prunes, smoke, alcohol, wood. Very good.

bottle shared by Cuso at RB Vienna March Tasting. brown / redish color, small white head. light smoky taste, slight malty sweetness, dried fruits, light liqueurish, overall malty sweetness is dominating. full body, light smoky taste again, malty sweetness, molasses, very subtle carbonation, very soft oily feeling, some spices, some wooden notes, liqueurish again, alcoholic. sweet / malty / alcoholic finish. pretty good.
Bottle at RateBeer Tasting Vienna March 2015 edition. Pours reddish color, lightly beige head. Aroma of smoked fish, bacon, raisins. Taste of cherry, bourbon, smoked fish, raisins, alcohol.
Bottle. Aroma lots of chocolate, raisins, prunes. Alcohol, light smoke. Very tempting. Clear dark brown colour. Taste is very rich, raisins, prune, rich malty character. Good one.
Pours a deep burgundy red almost black. Slight to no head. Aroma is smoked salmon, redcurrant and hazelnuts. Taste is caramel, hazelnuts and some red grape.
Bottle at home. Smoky bacon, toffee, berries on nose, quite smoky and dry, sweet fruits, rich caramel.

Bottle 500 ml at home, poured into a snifter. Thanks to Linick for this one! ABV 10%
Brown coloured beer, with a tall and thick tan head, average retention.Light lacing on the glass.
Aroma is very fruity, with red fruits, marmalade, vanilla, whiskey notes, caramel.
Tastes sweet, with lots of red fruits, notable alcohol both tastewise and as a warming feeling, caramel, wood, lots of whiskey notes partially because of the alcohol, some vanilla too.
Full body, creamy and smooth, with good carbonation, offering a bite on the tongue. A bit sticky on the palate. 
Overall this was a great beer, very enjoyable.
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Hazy dark red-brown coloured with vanilla and whisky flavours, spicy red fruit notes and a creamy, leathery, slight tart fruit finish.

Bottle courtesy of Benh. Love you Ben. Shared this with Ruslan and the gang at Beergeek. Unanimously loved. Pours dark Brown with an off-White head. Aroma is massive and leaves no doubt about what youre about to get in to. Toffee, Prunes, Spiced cake dough. The wood is apparent in the feint whisky notes. Its massive. Chocolate and fruit. Punching in all directions whilst being beautifully blended and well balanced. Tremendous stuff.

Bottle thanks to James (allmyvinyl). Pours opaque browny black. Very heavy bourbon nose, also lots of toffee. Very heavy in the alcohol. Taste is similar but much more balanced. Could probably do with less barrel aging.

50cl bottle thanks to allmyvinyl.
Appearance - opaque black/brown with a head that decent amount of lace, some of which hangs around. 
Nose - sweet bourbon notes with smoke. 
Taste - toffee and smoke, alcohol. Liquorice note from the combination of smoke and sweetness.
Palate - full bodied with a big sweet texture and a long but fairly well balanced finish.
Overall - almost like a browner maltier version of a barley wine. Its very good. I would love to try this beer without it having entered the barrel. It would probably hit 4.

A quality piwo with some barley and roasted malt. Deep body, good balance but that one contains a huge disappointment: The finish is definitely smoked. This makes tough to rate that one way above average.

Bottle from BenH - many thanks! The Scotch Ale pours out in a deep dark red-brownish colour with low head and medium body. Aroma of barley and roast. Taste of roasted barley, torf, woods, prunes, dark plums, campfire and rum. Finishes off smokey with light sour-leathery hints. It was nice and drinkable, but too much on the smoke-side for me.

Bottle @ tasting, courtesy of dEnk. Pours a clear dark brown beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma has barrel characters, roasted malts, caramel and well balanced. Flavor is very sweet, big caramel and roasted characters. There is a lovely whisky presence in this beer, not too overwhelming. Very well balanced. Lovely brew.

Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is malty caramel, fruity notes, some smokey notes, toffee, molasses and light liquorice. Promising. Flavour is roasty caramel, molasses, liquorice, a touch of yeast, wood and more. Very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2014 Bottle @home, bb 4th Jan 2014 (but ignore that) pours Brown with a ruby red hint. Big thick white head great lacing. Fruity nose with a malty sweetness, not dissimilar to a belgian quadruple. Dark fruits, plums, spices, oh eck this is one hell of a beer. Cherry and caramel, fruit cake, there is a sweetness about it but its not unpleasant, its not forced. You know its strong but it hides the alcohol well. Right at the very end you get this warming whisky kick that just takes this beer to a fantastic level.

Clear dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma has dark roasted malts, sweet liqourice, some woody notes, vainilla, whiskey. Flavour adds hard candy. Very harsh but complex. Alcohol is definitely present.

500 ml bottle. BB 04/01/2014. Courtesy of Brandman. 
Dark brown - almost black - colour with a small light tan head.
Whiskey sweetness, sweetish malt, woody dryness and vanilla in the aroma. 
The flavour is vanilla ice cream, woody dryness, very strong whiskey and strong sweetness. Strong and heavy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5 ltr bottle. Shared. Sample size ~0.2 ltr @ Rooie Dop brewdungeon. The aroma has smooth smokey tones, some sherry and some caramelic tones. Clear, red brown coloured beer with an off-white thin head. The taste is big, definately has the sherry going on which blends really nice with the subtle smokiness. Molasses, sweetness and caramel malts add to the body, which is still just a little too thin. But thats the only minor. More enjoyable with each sip.

Bottle from Cornelius. Pours deep brown with a touch of ruby. Small light brown head that fades fairly quickly. Molasses, smoke, sherry on the nose. Great body, sticky and a little thick. Coffee, sherry, a little treacle. Sweet finish. Delicious! Bottle says BB 18.12.2013 but I want to keep one for longer to see what happens...

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2014 Bottle courtesy of Dan - merci beaucoup! Pours a deep, deep brown with lighter ruby tinges. Aroma is dark berries, chocolate, some coffee chocolates, and some milk (maybe the bourbon barrel coming through). Taste is stunningly rich - dark fruits, coffee, bourbon, sherry, a little bit of milky creaminess. Full bodied (its like drinking a meal) and a finish that lasts ages, with a great sweet linger. This is the best beer Ive had for a VERY long time.

Bottle at home. Dark brown, thick beige head. Big smoke, soy ham, toffee, soft chocolate nose. Very complex and woody. Sweet front, huge toffee, some sherry fruits, lightest vanilla oak, warm soft booze, slightly hot prickly toasty smoky finish. Very subtle barrel characteristics, really skilful blending. Great rich sweetness, a true dessert beer. Definitely benefitted from a few months of age. Stunning.

500 ml bottle shared by Doodler (thanks Scott!) poured a clear reddish brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of toffee, smoke and light dark fruit. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of toffee, smoke and dark fruit with a smooth lingering smokey finish.

Bottle - thanks BenH! Pours cloudy reddish mahogany, large creamy tan head that sloooowly dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is quite malty, burned toffee, smoke, oaky. Flavor is similar, definitely smoky and malty. A touch of spiciness - almost holiday spices in the background. Not getting much bourbon per se, but there is a strong oaky barrel presence in both taste and the tannic astringence. Light to medium sweet, not a lot of bitterness, but the acidity is pronounced. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Some heat - drinks about like the 10% it is, maybe a bit hotter. All in all a nice beverage, just not world class.

Bottle picked up in Glasgow if memory serves. It pours darkest ruby-brown with a thick yellow-white. The nose is dark fruit, jam, sherry, wood, toast, mild smoke, cloves and mint chocolate. The taste is toast, smoke, scorched earth, dark fruit, raisin, wood, light jam, spice,meatiness, warming alcohol and vanilla with very dry finish. Full body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Smells amazing, but the taste is not quite there. A very well crafted beer nonetheless.

Slightly chilled bottle. Dark red with a big foamy head. Smell - very very toned down - slight yeast. Not much going on in the smell here. Body is medium and quite foamy. Taste - liquorice forward, toffee, slightly sharp, some coffee, raisin finish. Alcohol comes through just a little. Not bad.

Bottle from Beer Hive, Edinburgh [160913] 
Caramel brown, dark ruby light through, clear, off white head
Aroma - Raisin malts, little smoky, dark fruity malts, caramel, soft sherry, dab of molasses, some alcohol
Taste of rich fruity caramel malts, raisin, soft sherry, dark fruits, very soft smoke, barrel aging is subtle, quite boozy though
Palate - Medium carb, medium body, fairly syrupy sweet fruity palate, mouthcoating. Finish as main flavour, touch hot on the alcohol, bit of smoke on the tail
Overall - I like the subtle barrel aging here....perhaps a little too boozy

Bottle, many thaks to JohnRMurdoch. Deep dark coloured body with a ruby glint. Firm, fawn-coloured head. Mild smoked malty nose with a touch of dried fruits. Chocolate malty flavour, almost confectionery, joined by raisin and plums and followed by a sherry-like ending. Fine bodied. Very nice, enjoyed slowly as a night cap (hotel room, Edinburgh 10.08.2013).

BOTTLE (thanks to fonefan).

Head: beige, medium, frothy, avg. retention. Colour: deep ruby, almost black.

Aroma: intense and complex, soy sauce, smoked cheese, sweet dried fruit.

Taste: serious, sweet and salty, nice warming alcohol, dried fruit.

Super rich with a unique bouquet.

Thanks to Craig for this, consumed in a field at Cropredy Fairport festival 10th August 2013   Pours dark chestnut brown with large off-white head. Sweet in mouth, but also the whisky is very prevalent. Really tasty stuff but very pokey.  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6

50cl. Thanks Rian for sharing! Dunkelbraun im Glas, Geruch nach Schwarzwälder Schinken. Der Antrunk ist angenehm trocken und dabei leicht rauchig. Sehr komplex im Hauptteil! Tolle Aromenmischung von Kirschen, dunklen Früchten. Dabei leicht hefig-vollmundig. Auf der Zunge bleibt eine langanhaltende, leicht rauchige und leicht saure und sehr komplexe malzige Note!
--> absolut super!!!
13/13/14/14

Many thanks to BenH for this bottle! Smell is deep rich, dark malt. Some smokiness, ham and wood as well. Taste is deep dark fruit, some smoke, caramel, wood. It ends dry with lingering dark fruit and wood. The flavors are well integrated and complex. The body is medium/full - it is slick and juicy. Carbonation is average. A very nice sipper.

Bottle. Smoked meat initially dominates the nose, but quickly gives way to vanilla and vinous notes. Really complex. Smoke is present but doesnt dominate. Flavor is equally complex. Smoke, meat, vanilla, port almost. Really interesting beer.

Thanks to my old man for bringing this back from Scotland... 
Pour is dark brown with red notes, and a nicely looking think n frothy light tan head. 
Aroma has some nice barrel notes like plums and banana. Slight vanilla, caramel, (salty?) licorice, sherry notes.. Slight leather as well.. Quite complex actually.. 
The taste is somewhat sweet, with some faint bitter notes.. Slight watery body, with a fizzy carbonation. A boozy feeling in this one..

Poured reddish brown with an off white head. Aroma of roast malt and dark soaked fruit. Medium body, flavour is quite sweet, ripe berries, some toffee and a hint of liquorice. Interesting if not great.

Bottle shared at Deans sticky table tasting. Pours amber brown with an off white head. Aroma of ripe fruits, toffee, raisins and soap. Flavour is over moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Tasted once again at Taps Beer Bar, Changkat, Kuala Lumpur.  This is much better than the last example with a fruity alcohol creamy caramel aroma. A big fruity alcohol bitter palate that tends to dominate, but a better beer than I had before, hence the re-rate.


Bottle at the Deansos monthly RB tasting, July 2013. Poured a clear reddish brown with a thin white head. The aroma is rich fruity and a little smoky. The flavour is medium bitter, rich fruity alcoholic, liquorice. Not a favourite I must say.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 Bottle. Pours reddish brown. Aroma is wood, raisins, dark fruits and soap (lol). Flavour is heavy sweet with a little bitter. Not bad not great. 
Rerate: better than before. 8-3-7-4-16

sample at Deans Monthly Den Haag tasting courtesy of Sic1314.
Thins off white head. Clear burgundy pour. Interesting beer.

Bottle shared at the ChrisO Flags of Many Nations Easter Tasting 2013 - London. Pours clearish amber-russet with a fine, creamy head. Rich toffee in the nose, ripe dried fruits. Big sweet flavor with rich bread, hints of vanilla, light booze, dried plums, dates, some earth. Full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Warming finish with light vinous dryness, more ripe semi-dark fruits. Rich and warming but not too sweet or boozy. Excellent work.

500ml bottle at home aroma is a bit like Christmas pudding flavour is strong smokey booze and very fruity sweet slightly treaclely but still smooth drinking finish is smokey booze that gives a pleasant warming sensation good beer nicely crafted

50cl, new exclusive Scottish brew Anno 2013, from The Bottle Shop Canterbury, complex Scotch, sweet/malty and slightly fruity/alcoholic, yet not too heavy, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew, yet expensive!

Bottle 500ml. @ [ (Easter "Flags of many nations" Tasting) by Chriso - London ].Clear medium to dark amber colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, meat, smoke. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, sugary sweet, sweet smoke - meat, smoked, caramel, candy, alcohol warm. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20130331]
500ml bottle from Cornelius, Edinburgh - very dark brown near black, alcohol, vanilla aroma, very sweet, syrupy texture, not easy to drink
500ml bottle from Alesela shared with mr_h. Almost black, not much head. Spicy grassy alcohol malt aroma. Strong sweet treacle alcohol flavour. Sickly sweet aftertaste. Not my sort of beer.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2013 500ml Bottle at home from Alesela
Deep ruby with fluffy offwhite head. Oxidised cardboard notes on the nose wit sweetcure bacon and some caramel. Full bodied with medium carbonation, sweet warming booze, fruity smoke, sticky malt, robust malt. slight leather and tobacco notes, treacle and burnt sugar appear on warming...invert sugar? Sweet warming finish with some woody rummy notes. Nice to sip but 330ml bottle would be more than enough.

Bottle. Pours a really dark brown with a thick white heady. Booze, fruit and a little sherry in the aroma. The flavour is a revelation - complex dark fruit, coca cola, xmas cake mix, spice all held together with a thick alcohol sweetness. A very impressive beer.
Bottle shared at home, cheers Steven! Tempest - Please make this again immediately! That is all.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2013 Beautiful barrel nose. Slightly sticky rustic rich barrel sweetness. Smoke, peat, brown sugar. Rich deep brown colour with orange sparkles. Thick body but some initial fizziness. Sticky too. Needs time to develop in the glass. Some rigorous swirling makes everything fine. Potent too.

Couldnt look more like Coca-Cola if they tried in terms of body - dense brown with a light caramel tinge - and head - fizzy carbonation beige - if they tried. Streams of carbonation on the initial pour but head drifts away quietly.
Massive swathes of boozy smoke, stickly sweet oak. Initial taste on first pouring is sumptuously carbonated, but a little carry forward on the bourbon/sherry vibe. Dead centre vibe of melted caramel, crunchy enough but a threat of earthy/soily dusting taken away quickly by crystallise sweetness. The finish is equally so and continues the Coke vibe - like the dispense syrup from a Soda Stream, especially towards the end of the bottle/pour in syruppy sweetness and flat thickness clawing into the crevaces of your teeth and clinging on for dear life.
I love the development of this through the drinking and please I had it solo first. The initial half was very gulpable, even with the telling ABV. If someone handed me an ideal mix of Coke, JD, Sherry and a wee bit of dark malty/yeasty beer Id stupidly down pints of this. The carbonation and sweetnes meet in the middle in an explosion of malt. Clearly the yeast focus worked wonders. Id probably explode if I knew there was a cask of this knocking around.
Bottle, Cornelius, Edinburgh

Bottle many thx to Craig cons 2013-04-03 
AR: wee fruitiness
AP: dark ruby red, high stouthy wee bubbly cream brown head
F: mild, creamy, burned candy, wee peaty, vinos - maderia, sugary sweetinees, great flavours bad aroma!

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2016 bottle at home... deep red brown ... small tan head... deep rich sweet berry soft spirit nose ... dark rich sweet berry fruits ... rich chewy malts ... heavy roast ... dark malts ... chewy cherry mellow roast ... wow ... lovely keg at the bow...  Deep brown... Thin tan head... Soft sweet caramel malt nose.... Soft sweet toffee roast.. Juicy malts... Creamy malts... Soft toffee fruitd... Nice soft and Mellow.. 4.1Keg at the hanging bat.. Big boozy whisky. Soft malts nose.. Dark sweet malts... Light blackcurrant roast malts.. Big big booze3.6Keg at the herriot watt beer festival 2016.. Dark brown sweet toffee fruit malt nose..  Soft sweet fruits fruit... Juicy fruits.  Sweet caramelised fruits ..juicy sweet toffee fruit... Light spangles 4.0

Cask at hanging bat.... Dark sweet toffee caramel toffee fruit nose... Soft sweet floral fruit.. Juicy malts.. Soft sweet toffee fruit... Juicy sweet toffee fruit... Soft sweet caramel toffee fruit.. Rich sweet fruit.. Soft Sherry 4.1

31st March 2013Tasting at ChrisOs. Clear darkish amber beer, little pale tan head. Light palate, softish. Sweetish malts. Nice generic fruitiness. Fruit salad! Light touch of barrel and whisky. A little malt cream with a whisper of vanilla oak. Semi dry finish. Surprisingly sweet but tasty. Hides the abv well.

Bottle at Chriso Easter "Flags of many nations" Tasting, 31/03/13 thanks to Craig.
Clear chestnut brown with a small frothy beige head.
Nose is dark toffee, barley, woody notes, smoke, touch of whisky.
Taste comprises dark caramelised sugars, toffee, booze, woody, light whisky notes, more sugars.
Fullish bodied with fine carbonation, sweet finish with a touch of booze.
Decent stuff but overall a little too sweet for me, balance needs a tweak.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle.  Very dark brown with tan head. Nice big aroma, plummy, raisins, prune and also some spiced cake mix, toffee. Taste is fairly similar, dark fruits, cake mix and tofffee. Nice and sweet. The real deal, reminds me a lot of wee heavy. Not picking up much barrel influence.

Just amazing. I love Tempest beers but this is a new level. Very dark tan with good creamy head. Rich boozy and fruit malt aroma. Luxurious on the palate with little zings of carbonation. Massive puddingy boozy taste with heaps of dark fruit. Up there with Thornbridge Bracia for UK style.
